Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL choice”
Reviews.Author: Rmc055
Reviews.Content: We have come to KW for several years and opted to stay here-what a great choice! Parking wasn't hard to find, rooms were nice but beware of leaking ceiling if it rains. Staff was great with the exception of April. Guests pay your wages honey so don't be a snip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: Foodeysnob
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Even though it's a happening place, the noise level in the rooms was just fine. I was pleasantly surprised. The bar tenders are awesome, the staff was awesome, the breakfast is awesome and not just cause it comes with the room!!! It s really good! The french toast is the bomb! Located just enough off of the main part of Duval but still walkable distance to the hopping bar scene. Really enjoyed our stay here. I would definately stay here again with no problems!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: TareeG
Reviews.Content: This is a great place very friendly - love the atmospher. This was a lovely weekend getaway trip to Key West to celebrate my 40th birthday. We had a fabulous trip. There were 4 of us, my husband & I had a room right off the pool - it was very nice with a great view of the pool right out the french doors. Our friends stayed in a room on the second floor they had a great balcony entrance over looking the pool area as well. It's an older Key West building so don't be expecting the Ritz but as far as Key West B&B's go La Te Da is top notch. The breakfast area is beautifully decorated, the service is freindly & the food was great! Yes I would stay here again but there are so many other lovely B&B's in Key West not sure if I will get back to La Te Da.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: SaraBaudo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights (Feb 19-20) in room #24. Our room was the pefect size for two people. We were pool side and I felt that noise was not really an issue. My husband and I arrived on Sunday afternoon and check-in was a breeze. The staff helped take our luggage to our room & explained the events for the afternoon. They have a Sunday tea party (or something to that effect). It was a busy dance party with lots of cute guys and drinks. Too bad the guys were gay and I'm pregnant! But it looked like a lot of fun. The music died down later afternoon and the mood was set for the dinner crowd. We could not hear a thing in our room. Yes, there are roosters who crow early in the morning. So do bring ear plugs if you are light sleeper. We live in the city of Chicago, so noise does not bother us. The breakfast that is included with the room rate was absolutely delicious. Our server was amazing and really went the extra mile. This is not a luxery property, but a friendly and charming hotel right on Duvall Street. I would definitely stay again. I especially enjoyed the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Good Time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: kimlbi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at La Te Da. Great location and the breakfast included in the room rate was really good. Stayed in room 32 - bed was very comfortable and room was clean. Not in the deluxe category but good place at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, prime location, awesome restaurant and piano bar”
Reviews.Author: cruisequeenOrlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and could not have been happier. Room was large and clean. We had a deluxe king (room 25) on an end off of the pool...would ask for that same room again. The breakfast that came with it was a gourmet breakfast and very impressive. The restaurant has great food and the piano bar is a blast. It is a prime location on the quite end of Duval. The staff was super friendly. Can't wait to go back and saty there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great food and bar, room could be updated”
Reviews.Author: sixela331
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend in Key West - my boyfriend and I stayed here because it was extremely affordable and we liked the location. Our room was clean and fairly quiet. We were in #18 - in the morning we could hear them setting up the bar which was a bit annoying but there was no noise at night which is nice since it is right on Duval. Our bathroom could use a serious update, the brown tiles were soooo outdated! It was clean though and everything worked just fine. I enjoyed the bar - the breakfast vouchers were great and the food was excellent. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations for the price”
Reviews.Author: PAMedia
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Key West...spent 4 nights in room #25. The hotel is clean and comfortable but not "deluxe." I liked the location; we walked or rode bikes everywhere. Beware that it is loud late in the evening. I am glad I brought earplugs! We enjoyed the breakfast which was included daily. Happy hour was a good deal too. Don't miss Randy Roberts in the caberet! He puts on a great show! There is a 2 drink minimum at the show. Try their Key Lime Pie martini....yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmckerall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 6 nights in late January 2012. Clean, comfortable room with dresser, armoire, two chairs, flat screen tv, fridge, ceiling fan and large bathroom; our room (#19 right behind the bar/dining area) was large but was handicap accessible so others may not be as large. Window a/c unit mounted high on the wall kept good temp and provided some nice white noise to sleep. Staff was amazing, friendly, and extremely helpful from the desk to the bar to wait staff and hostess. We were up late most nights so the nightly music and bar crowd was not a problem, but if you go to bed before midnight, be aware of this, the place is hopping around the bar area. The drag show was great, don't miss it. If you have a car, be careful to park on a side street that isn't restricted parking. Note, the island is populated by roosters that like to crow at night, but this is an equal opportunity noise everywhere except perhaps at the big hotels in the waterfront areas. Easy walk to everywhere up and down Duval, this is the less busy end. I wouldn't recommend planning any pool time at least during the cool months; the pool is in a pocket in the center of the property and won't get a great deal of sun and is next to the dining area. Bikes can be locked up just outside the hotel on the street; metered parking (up to 12 hours actually) for loading and unloading your luggage from your car. Overall, a good hotel with personality and charm and a good value right on Duval street.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Schirms
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent! Close enough to walk to the beach and the nightlife, but in a quieter section of Duval. Staff is generally unfriendly and not very helpful with the exception of one bartender/girl Friday, Mindy. She was awesome! I would recommend this for location only.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: bkfisher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend and loved it! Right on Duval, so not far from anything--short walk to the bars/restaurants and 3 blocks from a quaint beach and Southernmost Point. Loved the jacuzzi tub in the room and the patio where we had made-to-order breakfast each morning, which was included with the price of our room. This was the best part of the experience hands down. Only reason not 5 stars was hotel and pool were a little worn down (which actually added to the charm) but totally worth the price you pay, as it's one of the least expensive hotels on Duval. The staff at the hotel was absolutely AMAZING, from the gentlemen at the check-in desk to the restaurant staff to the maid. Free parking on the side streets was extremely easy to find, so definitely believe the hotel when they tell you that. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay :)”
Reviews.Author: kimcherieen
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The rooms where a bit outdated, but clean and nice. The staff was excellent! Very helpfull and entertaining! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Two Week Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluetop1970
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Christmas and in to the New Year. We had dined here earlier in the year and so we were fairly familiar with the place. Service is warm and friendly whether at reception, the bar or in the restaurant. We were booked in to change rooms halfway through our stay (as planned - we were late-ish bookers) and the transfer was seamlessly managed with a smile. On change-over day, our heavy bags were there in our new room when we returned later in the afternoon. Breakfast is included in the price and is very good with three options plus fruit juice and coffee or tea. I would say that perhaps apart from offering the comp residents' menu, the hotel may be well served to show residents what else they can offer from the main breakfast menu. They would undoubtedly take a few more dollars if they did this. Service at breakfast was excellent and because of the length of our stay we soon got on very well with the waiters - all great guys. The rooms were comfortable. We stayed in a de luxe and then a luxury for the second half of our stay. To be completely honest, they both needed a little TLC here and there; minor 1 hour maintenance jobs. There had been a roof leak at some point in the past in our de luxe room and the paintwork stains had not been attended to. Also, the Jacuzzi bath tap was very impossible to turn so we made do with showers (which was fine for us). On the cleanliness front the ceiling fan blades could have done with regular cleaning. These were minor in the whole scheme of things but worthy of note all the same but also they should be easy enough to remedy so that they are not noted by guests in the future. The pool area was a nice place to chill out in the afternoon where the sunshine danced through the shade of the poolside palm trees. It has a truly charming feel - wooden decks and white painted balustrades everywhere around the pool - they must need a lot of maintenance - some areas more than others it has to be said. This after all is not a 7 star luxury resort with artificial perfection, painted smiles and corporate-style meets and greets. The staff made us feel very comfortable and at home here. Would we return here? We wouldn't say no but then we would probably want to try somewhere else just for the sake of trying somewhere else and not because we didn't enjoy our stay here (because we did). Last time we were in Key West, we stayed at the Southernmost on the Beach - that was good too but we like a change.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay on Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: gardavis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at La Te Da. The price was reasonable and location was very good. It was a bit of a walk to the Mallory Sq. area but not bad. The hotel is close to the "Southern-Most" area and the Butterfly attraction (very nice). There are parking meters in front and we used one during checkin and then moved the car to the side street (free) and left it there the whole weekend. The meter rate is high so it was not hard to find one. The room (one up from standard but almost identical to my sister's standard room) was very nice. The A/C was a bit noisy but it had a remote control. There is a refrigerator and flat-screen TV. It was clean and just off the pool. There is a nice restaurant and the room included full breakfast (the bacon was hefty and crispy - very good). There is entertainment - a few different shows different nights (did not go) and a couple at the piano in the bar which was nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. I wouln't hesitate to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Back Again for the Holidays 2011-2012”
Reviews.Author: ledaumas
Reviews.Content: As always, our favorite outdoor, classy bar. Great affordable breakfast until 1:00 pm for everyone. Nothing seemed to change this year. Our New Year Eve dinner was a wonderful filet and lobster, but a bit pricey (as is their restaurant) which kept crowds out on New Year's Eve (good for us, but not good for La Te Da). I love the fact that they have cheaper bar food on other days of the year so we can come more often. Jason, the bartender, is still there and the only one whose name we know since we only come once a year. He's cute, friendly and helpful. Of course, we saw Randy Roberts again and all the ladies he can play. Our teenage daughters adore him. We got tickets way in advance on Monday for his Friday show and got there at 7:45 for good seats. It's wonderful being able to hear the musicians from the indoor bar since we prefer the outdoor bar. We live in Houston and always make sure we go to La Te Da several times where we've met interesting people from all over the world. By midnight, we all felt like friends as we welcomed the New Year!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rlughermo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in November 2011 as the normal place I book at was filled. (See what I get for waiting till the last minute!) Fortunately La Te Da had at least one room left. Nice, clean rooms and the facility overall was really nice and clean. A bit fancy for my blue-collar type of tastes but no complaints about the place. The restaurant on premises has FANTASTIC, mouthwatering food. I will definitely consider this location again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Place!”
Reviews.Author: dkritter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated his 50th birthday in Key West--I am so happy that I chose La Te Da!! We stayed in a luxury room on the second floor, enjoyed breakfast and afternoon drinks there every day (and sometimes later night bar snacks!), and loved the access to Duval and all the interesting areas of Key West. We thought the staff was especially accomodating in all areas. I loved the variety of entertainment we had just at La Te Da! Chris Peterson was very entertaining as were the singer/piano player there on Friday and Saturday nights. At times, sitting outside at breakfast with the big band/1930s music playing in the background, I imagined we were living the life of the Great Gatsby. We will definitely consider staying at La Te Da again if my husband and I travel to Key West again...

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Michele B
Reviews.Content: Staying at La Te Da was the "cherry on top" of a fabulous trip to Key West. It's a wonderul, authentic property exhibiting colonial plantation panache. As so many have stated, the service of each staff member is top notch from the desk staff to the wait staff to the bartenders. The pool area is unique in that it is adjacent to the dining area, but the foliage around it is so skillfully planned that there is plenty of privacy for those who want to take a dip. The luxury foam king sized bed was a dream. My husband and I have never slept so blissfully away from home! A FREE beautifully prepared breakfast on the covered terrace each day was such a delicious plus! The hotel has a stellar location. We left the car and walked everywhere (although a $7 taxi ride gets you from one end of Duval to the other). A quiet, peaceful, perfect tropical retreat. We will return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Way great!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChowdaddyFishers_IN
Reviews.Content: From the time I phoned to inquire about a reservation and spoke with Chris, to our check-in (also, coincidentally, with Chris) and throughout our several day stay, this place was beyond great. We loved everyone there, our room (at the back) was a luxury room and was very nice, and the bar area was so much fun (loved the Monday through Friday happy hour specials, could have used them on the weekend, too!!!). We went to the Cabaret and saw Chris Peterson's Eyecons, and had an absolute blast. When we reluctantly checked out to return home, the manager, LJ, even helped carry our luggage outside and put it into our SUV. We had a marvelous time there, the property is on Duval Street, but it's at the quiet end and so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Great Character & Location”
Reviews.Author: TripQueen2
Reviews.Content: The staff was lovely and made you feel right at home. I would not recommend the hotel for young children or families. The hotel is a hot spot on the weekends and can be loud. The free breakfast is a plus--and you can't beat the price for being right on Duval Street (where all the action is). Bring ear plugs if you want to go to sleep early.

Reviews.Title: “Well, "La Te Da!"”
Reviews.Author: dmartiniup
Reviews.Content: Many hotels have a personality that a guest "feels" upon entry. At La Te Da in Key West, it is like a big hug! The warmth of this cozy little hotel, tucked up on the quiet end of Duval Street emanates from the Manager Chris, but it is classy, not "homey"--it is upscale and fashionable, yet totally comfortable in flip flops or designer lines. Even if you're not staying at the hotel (unfortunate for you!) the restaurant and bar are worth a visit, any time of day or night as the meals are scrumptious and beautifully presented. The service is again, warm, friendly and filled with laughter--bring your sense of humor or stay home! The outside bar has a tasty menu and casual ambiance but the inside bar feels more like a quiet nightclub, until the entertainment starts--then who knows what will happen next! Recently, Dave Bootle a gregarious entertainer, played piano and within an hour, had the small crowd shaking its united Bootie! Sassy, the bartender added to the convivial atmosphere, trading barbs with Bootle. I've never seen so many people in the bar and everyone was laughing, singing, trading partners and having a ball! Gay, straight or "flexible"--it doesn't matter at La Te Da--put on your party shoes or sandals and enjoy a rare find in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Happily, it was one of the only places available the night I drove in.”
Reviews.Author: Andreeh
Reviews.Content: After spending the day with Amoray and getting open water certified in scuba, I headed for Key West a bit late. It seemed like all the hotels and B & B's were full or I was a little put-off by the person on the phone. When I called La Te Da the front desk person was very warm and friendly and I had high hopes for a room. As it turned out the room was just off the restaurant, had a little patio, french doors, two large beds and a jacuzzi tub big enough for a party. I walked up Duvall Street to take in the sites and came back to a quiet bar where I sampled their version of a lemon drop with a plate of scallops! The bartender was very nice. As I found a coffee shop in the morning on the other side of town, I never did sample the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “La Te Da Surprise !”
Reviews.Author: Jiffy69
Reviews.Content: It was my 70 th birthday 2/6/11 and my two sons booked a reservation for me and my husband for 5 nights at the charming La Te Da Hotel. It seamed so private and homey when we arrived....even though we had to park out front on the busy street and the office mgr. helped us take our bags to our rooms and then we had to find a place to park our car......No problem....found a space on the side street across from the B & B which is what I would call La Te Da as your breakfast comes with the price of your room. ( 3 or 4 choices) We ate several other meals there which were very good and medium priced. There are several other restaurants close to this hotel. The pool was visible from the dining area (covered open air dinning area) and I didn't feel comfortable sitting by the pool because of the people eating while I was sunbathing. The pool is small and needs renovating ! We had to also walk through the dinning area to go upstairs to our room but we would go around the outside edge of the eating area when leaving or returning. Some of the rooms are down stairs but you still have to go through or around the dinning area. Our kids did a great job with their choice of lodging for my celebration....and the surprise was....our son's and their wife's arrived from TX. Friday Afternoon for 3 nights to celebrate with me !! Their rooms were close to ours at La Te Da. The rooms were cottage like and very clean and comfortable. Even though this is an older place....they have mantained it pretty well. La Te Da is close to the southern most point in the US....only about 3 blocks to the water and about a 1/2 mile up Duval St. to the all the rest of the activities !! We walked to everything....except when we rented bikes from a bike rental only 1 block from La Te Da. An Ice Cream House is just a couple blocks down the street !!! During the more busy and noisy time of the night at the north end of Duval street La Te Da is far enough to the south end for a quiet and peaceful evening in your room or a relaxing - late dinner or drink at the bar. It was a fun filled 5 days ....not just because of turning 70 but because La Te Da made our stay so comfortable.....they also made our reservations for our sunset cruise and gave me good information about the parasailing I enjoyed on my 70th birthday !!! We did not see the dinner show or the entertainment at La Te Da. I would recommend staying there to our friends !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful fun and superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTriplets
Reviews.Content: First visit to Key West for a three couple "adult fest" -- meaning no kids traveling with us. La Te Da is a lovely location that is a scooter ride from everywhere. The on site bar and free morning breakfast is heavenly. The room accommodations are unique and true to the residence. We were traveling with 2 other couples and enjoyed multiple evenings at the lovely bar and listened to the live entertainment while people-watching the night life. The pool area is pretty, but small -- no Olympic training! :- ) But a lovely environment to sit on the chaise and read smutty magazines while planning a day of adventure. It is definitely my "go to" for our next trip to Key West -- my own personal "snow bird" residence.

Reviews.Title: “I have a new favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NcMich711
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Te Da for 4 nights with some friends for a girls getaway. Absolutely loved the hotel! It was charming, it was convenient (right on Duval, but up a bit) it was affordable and the rooms was quaint and clean. What else do you need while in Key West? There are two bars located on the premises (one in and one outside), breakfast was included in the room rate and it was delicious and a great way to start each day. Everyone was so friendly - both guests and staff. This is definitely my new hotel in KW! Thank you for a wonderful time - even though we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, it is the basis for whether or not you are comfortable and we surely were!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: amanda t
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© came down to Key West for the first time and we were recommended to stay at La Te Da. I will stay here ever single time we go now! They are so wonderful and accommodating. This place truly is a hidden gem of Key West. The Sunday Celebration was fun, festive, and really gets the party going! The courtyard pool really bring the essence of the place together. Its located in the quite more historic section of Duval which ended up being even better. Parking can be a bear but its like that all over KW. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Neatest hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Nita F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several years ago and loved it then. When we decided to return to Key West, La Te Da was the only hotel we considered. It's an adult only hotel. No children under 21. The rooms are well appointed. They are not the fanciest in the Keys, I guess, but they are clean, nice and they employees are wonderful. We loved the intimacy and the quietness of the small hotel. the pool is nice. Great comped breakfast every morning. delicious food!! Robin makes a killer Mimosa and is a great friend. Everyone was so wonderful and checked on us to make sure we had all we needed. We will not stay anywhere else in Key West. It is right on Duval, so you can walk to almost anywhere. The only down thing was..no coffee pots in the rooms. but I just walked out of my room and great employees were happy to get me a cup!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Adein
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say thanks to the staff of la te da for giving us such a great experience during our stay. The room was well kept and clean, although we didn't spend too much time there since the beach was only a couple blocks away. At night, the hotel is in a quieter section of duval street, but all the bars and restaurants are within a 10-15 minute walk down the street. Also, the complementary breakfast in the morning was amazing. We will be back when we return to key west.

Reviews.Title: “Prettiest restaurant on the Key”
Reviews.Author: tpgel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped in for dinner one evening. This has to be the nicest looking restaurant on Duval. The staff was professional. We both had the crispy lacquered duck with carrots and asparagus. The duck was cooked exceptionally well as were the vegetables. We were a little disappointed in the wheat pasta served on the side. However, the portions were large. Prices were generally 20-30 for an entree which is average for Key West. Can't beat the ambiance, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Quaint!”
Reviews.Author: beachinchick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the recommendation of an acquaintance and we really didn't know what to expect. We were so pleasantly surprised. It was so cute and homey and had a really cool bar and pool. Breakfast was included with the room and very tasty. The location was fantastic and we parked our car and we were within walking distance of everything. The office staff, bartenders, and waitresses were very nice and accommodating. This is a very reasonably-priced and fun place to stay. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: married_n_Tortola
Reviews.Content: We took a very last minute trip to Key West and had a recommendation to stay at the La Te Da. It must have been kismet because they had availability and it was truly wonderful! Now, if you are looking for a five star, all inclusive resort, this really isn't your type of place. However, if you are looking for something very low key and laid back, you've found it. We got to stay in two different rooms. Both were very nice, unique and clean. (Cleaning staff are totally on the ball!) Breakfast is included and it was just heavenly. I heard from everyone that you must go to Blue Heaven for breakfast. We had full intentions to visit it, but...the breakfast was so fantastic AND INCLUDED that I hated to pass it up. If I got up earlier, perhaps I could have eaten at both! It also has a lovely pool, which is shaded and cool on hot afternoons as well as a clothing optional sun deck that is very private. The only (slightly) negative is that parking is a bit of an issue. There's no designated parking and street parking is very hard to obtain. So here is how we dealt with it. We turned in our car the day after we got there and we never missed it! You don't really need one anyway. Even though La Te Da is on the far end (and the best at that) it's not that far to walk to the more touristy part of Key West. Speaking of, it is a lot more quiet there. But that doesn't mean it isn't A LOT OF FUN, because it is! From the drag show (which is a must), to Tea Dance on Sunday afternoon, as well as Dave Bootle on Thursday and Saturdays, it's almost hard to go anywhere else. If you don't enjoy yourself at the La Te Da, you might want to check for a pulse! Now I've mentioned a lot of great things but the absolute best part of La Te Da is hands down, the staff! From Eric, Chris and Christina at the front desk, to all of the wonderful kitchen,wait and housekeeping staff (like Cheryl). As well as the stellar bar staff! Mindy, Doug and the best bartender ever, Derek! We love them all! They treat you great but once they know you are staying there, you're treated like royalty! If you are considering staying in Key West, you absolutely MUST STAY at THE LA TE DA! We're already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Xena498
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a two night stay. Chris at the check in desk was friendly and made us feel welcome. We drove in from Miami and Chris informed us of the best parking available. We stayed in Room 28 which is a luxury King. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable. The jucuzzi was outdated and has seen better days. But overall the room was comfortable to sleep. THe pool was a disappointment. It is situated next to the dining area and very small, in need of repairs. I would have liked more privacy from the hotel guests and people using the bar and restaurant. THe breakfast is included and was great. Large portions, excellent food. Only compaint here is the second day, our waitress informed us that even though the breakfast was free a tip was expected. This was outragous. This is unacceptable that a waitress is TELLING us to tip her. We always tip very generously but was appalled with her bad manners. I only hope the managment will talk with the wait staff about this practice. People are on vacation and expect to tip well and dont need a waitress telling us to tip. Location is great on Duvall Street. Walking distance to all the excitement. Overall, good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing can't wait to return!!!”
Reviews.Author: carlyjason
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed there on our Honeymoon in June and it was so nice the breakfast was included every morning and it was delicous i will go back just for that! thje room was so charming and cute very nice the pool was very nice as well we cannot wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynnvara
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I got married in the corner of the bar area Monday July 11 at 11:00. The best wedding I have ever had. The staff made it fabulous. Our room was wonderful, the shower was great, the food is excellent, breakfast was included which off set our alcohol tabs. Our most favorite of all was the Staff: I cried all the way to the airport. They are like family without all of the crap. I will name a few: Daniel, Eric and Christopher @ the front desk, Mindy, Tonto, Derek and King Doug behind the bars and Kat was our server. They will always, always, have a place in my heart. I felt like Dorothy leaving Oz. Been to KW many times. Always ended up at the bar outside and dined the restaurant many times prior to staying there. We will continue to go to KW. We will never stay anywhere but La Te Da. I LOVE YOU ALL!!!!! God Bless our friends at La Te Da. P.S. I failed to mention there were 10 of us in the group, what a freaking blast we had. Thank you again everyone at La Te Da, WE LOVE YOU VERY MUCH XOXOXOXO Lynn :) and Tommy

Reviews.Title: “A great place to experience Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Shocks
Reviews.Content: The entire staff were very friendly and provided great service. A quick check-in even though we arrived fairly late in the evening. Breakfast came with room. We selected either the All American or the French Toast everyday we were there. Large portions. We had a lunch, a dinner and dessert -the key lime pie was to die for! Loved the tea party on Sunday afternoon! What fun! Met some new friends who invited us to their wedding there at the hotel on Monday and were very impressed by the event! The room was comfortable and right by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “great location but watch out for the begging breakfast waitress”
Reviews.Author: cherylmarner
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at La Te Da on a bed & breakfast basis - Eric on reception offered fantastic service with a great attitude - friendly and kind. The room was dated but clean and comfortable. The breakfast menu was varied and food was beautifully presented, however, watch out for the 'begging waitress'. As our breakfast plates were cleared we were reminded that we 'should' leave a tip and the waitress recommended $6 per person, having told the waitress that we were offended that she should ask in such a 'matter of fact way' for money she stated the following: . Her wage was $4 per hour . She would be offended that if we did not tip it represented bad service . We were staying in the only hotel that offered a free breakfast ( we paid for a bed & breakfast rate!) . We can afford to tip! Our thoughts - only work in a service industry if you have true passion for service, do your job well and be rewarded. Having eaten out everyday and stayed at 6 different hotels we always left a tip but the attitude of the staff at La Te Da not only asking for it but arguing with us as guests as to why we should tip has amazed us.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe excellent reviews; place is falling apart...”
Reviews.Author: bowman716
Reviews.Content: I travel to Key West regularly staying at every conceivable style of accommodation. I like old homes converted to hotels and understand/expect a certain level of quirkiness. However La Te Da needs major help... The Good Stuff: Great location Reasonable rates Breakfast included with room Friendly/professional staff On sight entertainment/bars Clean room and bath It goes down hill real fast; Walkways and stairs are in dyer need of repair/replacement. Felt unsafe; like many steps and railings could give away at anytime. Old construction materials, kegs and garbage thrown behind and under stairs. Over grown weeds on roof tops and over hangs. My room's french doors and windows look original. Over time have dropped, no longer shut tight or at all. Been eaten away by termites/water damage, broken panes, missing paint, etc. Room's air conditioner is too loud and not able to cool room. Ceiling fans need thrown out! Unbalanced/bad bearings; too loud to sleep... Bed was hard with cheap linens. Poor TV reception with no DVD or pay channels. Low water pressure. Bathroom mirror has burn marks all over it??? I spend 100+ nights per year in hotel rooms and have never seen this anywhere... It's a shame La Te Da has fallen onto such disrepair. Regardless of affordable rates and free breakfast, would only recommend as a last resort. With some major investment and rebuilding it could be the charming property it'd past life and location deserve.

Reviews.Title: “Love La Te Da”
Reviews.Author: electriclady111
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was a combo honeymoon double birthday and coming out party. It's hard to find the words to say how much we both appreciate their exquisite hospitality. Cabaret show is a must see. Piano bar a delight. Their restaurant is marvelous and service impeccable. Can't wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! We will never stay anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: MargeryBrick_NJ
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Key West for several years and have stayed in different places each time just to try something different, but once we stayed at La Te Da, we cannot be happy anywhere else. The other properties were okay ( I cannot be negative about staying anywhere in paradise!), but the La Te Da has that special "something". Starting with Chris at the front desk, to the most lovely waitress who served us breakfast every morning, to Derek the bartender, EVERY employee we came in contact with made us feel like we are friends for life, instead of customers. The property is beautiful (any negative reviewers need to remember how very old the buildings are, in fact we are lucky to be able to experience them at all). You can have your privacy and go about your business completely unnoticed, or come out and get involved as much as you want with the goings on; the piano bar, the street bar, etc. You actually have the best of both worlds and can make your choice while staying at the same place. We have stayed in 3 different rooms and they were all roomy and furnished perfectly for the island atmosphere. The breakfast included is the best deal and delicious. Location is great... But, my husband cautions me not to go on with any more positive insight! Because, if I convince everyone that La Te Da is the place to stay when visiting Key West, we may not be able to get a reservation when we take our next trip!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Something bugs me about this place . . .”
Reviews.Author: Bottombet
Reviews.Content: I stay in Key West often and have stayed at many of the bed and breakfasts and also several of the five star resorts. This is the first one I have felt compelled to review here. First, this hotel is one of the older hotels in the area. It has that classic Key West lodging feel that I've always enjoyed. The rooms are a bit dated but still quite nice, except for one major problem, but I'll get to that. The restaurant and bar have a great vibe with awesome food and a super-friendly staff. Be sure to check them out when you're in town! Daily breakfast at the restaurant was included with my room - what a great treat! Now for the bad part: TERMITES! I'm quite accustomed to small ants, spiders, gnats, etc in south Florida - no big deal. It's quite another thing though to wake up with piles of termite and their recently shed wings covering the white-tiled bathroom floor every morning. I mentioned it at the desk but was told that termites are unavoidable in the keys. I have never experienced them anywhere else in the world, much less on prior trips to Key West. The maid did her best to sweep them away daily but more quickly returned within a couple of hours. It's very disconcerting to get up in the morning and find termites on the drapes, room divider curtains, towels, bathmat, bedroom and bathroom floor. They even got into my bathroom shaving kit. Egads! It was like a Hitchcock movie! I'm not sure if this is a seasonal clustering or if it's this way all the time, but it really ruined the enjoyment of my stay. I was so pre-occupied with worrying about bringing them home to eat my house that I found relaxation at the hotel a bit difficult. Chunks of the hardwood floor the size of a quarter are missing where the little critters have eaten the underlying wood. I just can't believe that when termites are this obvious and this destructive that the folks at La Te Da haven't found a way to control them. So, go to La Te Da for the food, the bar, the friendly staff but, unless you enjoy a termite infested vacation, your lodging is best found elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at a reasonably priced hotel on Duval.”
Reviews.Author: stephie3988
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Easter Sunday and checked out Monday the 25th of April. The hotel was very nice and Dan at the front desk was wonderful. We were able to check-in 1.5 hrs early and check-out 1 hr late at no additional charge. We stayed in room 28 a luxury king, room was spacious and clean, jacuzzi bathroom could use some work. The main sundeck by the pool was very nice and the pool was in the shade. Sundays features a "tea party" which is a primarily drag/gay party. The hotel is a gay friendly establishment, make sure you are comfortable with this before you go as you will definately experience it. The included breakfast was great, service could be friendlier though. We will be returning in June to stay in room 27 that goes out to the pool. Overall a wonderful experience at a reasonable price right on Duval, could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn7497
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Key West and stayed at the LaTeDa. We loved it. Loved the breakfast, location was perfect, and really loved our room. We were on the second floor with a balcony. Hard wood floors in the room, vaulted ceilings and very comfortable bed. If you like to get lots of sun by the pool this place may not be for you. The pool area is very small, but pretty and my husband swam. I did not swim but did enjoy a very relaxing nap laying by the pool (in the shade). It feels very secluded. We walked everywhere and did not need a cab. The beach is just a couple blocks walk. I would say that if you are a light sleeper and not one to stay out late, the piano bar is very loud and lively and may keep you up. One evening, we sat on our balcony overlooking the piano player/singer and enjoyed a cocktail. The entertainment at the bar was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBurnham
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to La Te Da in Key West was as nice as the first, a few years ago. Stayed in a Standard room, which was just fine for the two of us. Clean room, prompt maid service, comfortable bed. Each room at this hotel is unique - we stayed in #33, which is tucked away in a secluded part with a second story balcony overlooking the small pool. Breakfast comes with the room. If the three breakfast choices seem too limiting, there is a menu to order from and pay for separately. Happy hour at the open-air bar is from 11 AM till 6 PM, but the guests are not at all rowdy. Live music during the dinner hour at the La Te Da restaurant. Location is at the "quiet end" of Duval Street, a couple of blocks from the Southernmost Point. This time we did not bother taking a car to Key West since we found everything is walkable or easy to reach by cab if necessary. Did not eat dinner at the restaurant this time, but they were busy every night and we heard nice comments about the food. Instead, we ate at Kelly's SaraBeth, and La Tattoria and enjoyed them very much. It's always great to get fresh fish and seafood when those are hard to come by in the Midwest.

Reviews.Title: “I think of this vacation all the time”
Reviews.Author: micktodd11
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. The food in the hotel was spectacular, the entertainment in the piano bar was phenomenal - the lady even gave us a copy of her CD - one of my partner's favorite movies is The Colour Purple and she sang from the soundtrack - just amazing all around. Key West was one of the best vacations I've ever taken - and I've been around the world. But the La Te Da was really exceptional. I wouldn't say luxurious, but fun, friendly, and just high end enough. We actually cancelled our nights in Miami and sucked up the penalty to stay here a couple of more nights. I can't wait to return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: timetorelax2011
Reviews.Content: The place looked ok when we first got there. When we got to our room I found hair in the bath tub, the rug looked old and stained, there where loose tiles under the rug. The next day we turned on the A/C it only blew luke warm air. We had to open the doors to keep it cool in there. Also the water temp. changed when someone flushed the toliet. The weather was great the sun sets great the room not so great.

Reviews.Title: “Always Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: ledaumas
Reviews.Content: The 2009 - 2010 Holiday season was our third year for the holidays in Key West. We loved the location, and the rooms were fine for the price. The rooms are not small to me. The less expensive rooms don't have bathtubs which I missed, but could live without for two days. We mostly spent time at the outdoor bar where we met all kinds of people. For the three years we've been here, we can always meet anybody and enjoy their company even if we never see them again. Lateda truly represents "One Human Family." We always enjoy their breakfast and their lunches are good too. But their dinner entrees are overpriced, unfortunately. We can't see ourselves spending $18 on spaghetti. So, we ordered from the bar menu, at the bar, which was fine since the street scenery is always amusing. The inside bar would have been interesting, but people smoke there. That must be good for the smokers who can't find a smoking bar. That bar was packed almost every night, more than the outside bar with open air. I think those were locals in there. However, for those of us in the outdoor bar, who can't possibly stand the smoke but wanted to hear music, we were able to enjoy the wonderful musicians every night that were in the indoor bar. We also saw Randy Roberts twice. He was well worth the $26 on a regular night and $50 for New Year's Eve. His Lady Gaga was so unique! He's certainly got energy to put on a show that like with so many singing personalities! The 5-minute walk to the beach to see the sunset that far South, is also an experience we'll never forget. It's my wallpaper on my cell phone now.

Reviews.Title: “We were lied to by the staff”
Reviews.Author: hisnoop
Reviews.Content: Called up and made a reservation for the show to see Randy. We were told there were no reserved seating, so it was first come first seated. Showed up a hour early for the show. 3 or 4 tables down front we taken and 15 or so tables behind those were empty. They told us those were reserved. We said we were told there were no reserved tables. The hostess got the manager who said "If you don't like were we are seating you you can get your money back" That is exactlly what we did after standing in line again. I suggest you skip this show. I do not think it is worth $26 pp anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The heart and soul of a real Key West retreat !”
Reviews.Author: buffalosisters
Reviews.Content: We have rented beautiful homes & condos other years, but I always wanted to stay at La te Da. It did not disappoint. The room was fabulous. The breakfasts were lovely. The bars are the prettiest and most fun of any in Key West. All this would be enough, but what really makes you fall in love with LTD is the staff. Many thanks to Chris, Eric, Doug, Robin & RALPH!!!

Reviews.Title: “brunch?”
Reviews.Author: finz44
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the lateda for the sole purpose of the sunday brunch which has been advertised extensively. an ad was posted on a marque outside the restaurant on monday of the week we stayed. when we tried to make reservations on friday we were informed that it was only done during "high season". the brunch is wonderful and we had about 25 people who were disappointed. this is very false advertising. i will not stay there again nor will many of the people in our party. we were extremely disappointed. furthermore the bartender was extremely rude.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis at the saner end of Duval”
Reviews.Author: MargeryBrick_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days at the La Te Da for my birthday. At first we were concerned about filling up five days on Key West, but in the end we were very sad to leave! The B & B is at the quiet end of Duval (a few of blocks from the Southernmost Point), so after the craziness nearer to Mallory Square you can come "home" to the upper class, well- behaved group! The location was perfect; since the island is so small it is easy to get anywhere from this location. You may have to walk a little bit further for the festivities, but that means you can eat alot more, since you will walk it off! It is the only B & B that serves a full cooked to order breakfast that is included in your room price, not just danish and fruit like the others. This is a very big saving and delicious, too. Very elegant white tablecloth eating area outside by the lush tropical pool adds to this special deal. All staff we came in contact with were extremely nice and helpful. We would stay there forever if we could!

Reviews.Title: “Best Key West Vacation”
Reviews.Author: curtgreen40
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, price. customer service, breakfast Cons: Water pressure, no coffee pot in room, cable/tv could be updated... Absolutely wonderful time at the LaTeDa. Stayed in Room 27. The employees treat you wonderful. If you want 5 star service, go down the road and pay $350 a night...if you want a nice clean room, near the beach, on duvall street with a $30 breakfast thrown in for good measure...stay here. This is my first choice when I come back to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great time!”
Reviews.Author: uturnxxx
Reviews.Content: I loved the friendly service and old style Key West appearance. The rooms were very cozy as well as the hotel in general. The complimentary breakfast is very satisfying and some good choices too. The location is perfect â€“ south end of Duval street. You can easily walk to the beach in just minutes or head the other way and experience all of the other interesting people and places Duval Street has to offer. The hotelâ€™s pool is a great place to relax after venturing out any time of the day and the street side bar is always open with an entertaining staff and good view of all that is happening in that area. While I was there, people off the street seem to stop by LaTeDa for anything from lunch or dinner to a whole evening of fun and entertainment. I had a very good visit!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Full of life”
Reviews.Author: Charming80
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed at La Te Da Hotel this past weekend. Would like to say we had a wonderful experience! Staff were very friendly and welcoming The rooms were cozy and charming. The hotel location in the area of Duval, my Mother and I met a lot of locals. It gave you a smalltown feel. The bar located in hotel is another "Cheer's bar" everyone will know your name, or get to know your name. All I can say is TWO THUMBS UP! I like to tell, Chris , you are a doll and Doug, you never sit down !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff/Nice place”
Reviews.Author: 3rdsister
Reviews.Content: First of all the staff was great. Very friendly and eager to please. Breakfast is included (3 choices) and was delicious and quite generous portions. Have stayed here before and love the lushness of the pool area. The pool was refreshing after being out in the August heat. Many other pools feel like bath water but this one is cool due to all of the trees. However, the pool needs to be redone. There are many cracked and missing tiles and needs to be resurfaced. The beds are not up to par with what you pay for the rooms. They need replacing. The a/c could not handle the size of the room. A much larger unit is necessary to cool everything down, including the bathroom. We didn't experience any problem with water pressure like other reviews claimed. We got lucky with parking, but had to drive around for some time before a close spot became open. If you go, leave your car parked and rent bikes or scooter. Much easier way to get around and see the island. Sorry La Te Da, but unless some upgrades are made, we will check other accommodations on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy historical B&B”
Reviews.Author: LoveByTheBeach
Reviews.Content: Walking into the lobby was like walking back in time. A beautiful old Key West home with the hard wood and tile. The beautiful cement pool is shaded and surrounded by ferns. The pool was a gem after a long day of riding bikes all over the island. It was always cool and refreshing. The room was quaint but roomy. It was exactly what we expected from an historic B&B. I think that some of the negative reviews have been because of expectations not any real problem with the hotel. The staff was fabulous and the room was cleaned every day. The A/C was a window unit but our room was always cool, even cold. There were three choices for the free breakfast or you could order from the full menu. There was indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor seating had lots of large fans to make it pleasant even in August. The outdoor bar is near the street so you sit for drink and watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience, nothing negative, but nothing to rave about.”
Reviews.Author: ashlov71
Reviews.Content: Pleasant staff, good service, we stayed in an upstairs "luxury" room. Furniture/decor was pretty nice, room was very clean, nothing "luxurious" about the room, though. We put the AC on 70, but it always felt too warm in the room. Water pressure in the shower was lower than I'd prefer, but it was passable. I wouldn't complain about having to stay there again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do so. Overall, a pretty average experience.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! WHAT A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: PEQUA1767
Reviews.Content: It has seen it's better days! The room we were in #26 was older then me and never updated. The floors were stained and scraped really bad. The furnishings looked like they came from a garage sale and spray painted. The beds were the worst with no support, TV was super old and only a few channels. The bathroom was super old and the tiles were faded and cracked or missing, the shower was an afterthought im certain. The pool was a mess with tiles missing and large cement patches all over, There is not one parking spot either! With so many choices in the Keys this is one dump you should pass on. Rotting wood just about everywhere also I wonder what is holding this craphole up!

Reviews.Title: “HAD A ROMANTIC WEEKEND AT LA TE DA”
Reviews.Author: Ambitiousgal24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived to LA TE DA late Friday night and Chris waited for us to arrive to show us to our room (after 9:50PM). They gave us an upgraded room for the same price and let me tell you...it was fabulous! It was so clean and romantic! The next morning our breakfast was sooo great! Make sure to order the American b/c the potatoes are to die for! Each day our room was cleaned and the staff was so nice and friendly. The hotel itself is on the quieter side of Duval, but a very short walking distance from the crowded areas. Our dinner there was top notch and our waiter, Andrew, was super friendly and gave us great advice on where to go and what to do. Wanted a nice, fun, and romantic weekend away from the kids and our busy lives, and this was just what we were looking for. They are friendly, clean, and very accomodating. Great place to getaway for the weekend. THANK YOU LA TE DA!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: DrBob050
Reviews.Content: $192.38 per night. Room way small. TV 19". Air conditioner could not be set below 72 degrees or it would freeze up. The biggest problem was there is no parking at this hotel. They tell you to use street parking, which, after circling for 45 minutes, wasn't available. I asked for my money back and they gave me a full refund. I went 1 block away to a Best Western. Got a room twice as big for $75 less per night. TV 40" flat screen HD.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PKn
Reviews.Content: We were not actually staying in the hotel but went daily for drinks & several meals until one of the guys behind the bar, an older than usual man, was so rude to us about the method of paying, wouldn't let us run a tab, said it was too busy, there were 8 people in the place at the time, he was also smoking behind the bar, very off putting, been in hundred of bars & hotels in the US over the last 15 or so years, this guy was the worst bar tender we have come across,apart from him a super place. Pat Knight, Leeds UK

Reviews.Title: “What a great night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: jhcopester
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel and really enjoyed our stay. They have a rather "colorful" party on Sunday afternoon, but after the festivities ended, the hotel was quiet and relaxing. The pool, though small, was open 7 x 24 since this is an adults only location. The included breakfast was excellent. The room we had was spacious, cool, and comfortable with the free WiFi convenience. It is at the quiet end of Duval and an easy walk (1/2 mile) to many of the bars and restaurants that provide a great time. Parking is the only issue but we were lucky enough to find a spot just around the corner (not metered and free) several times. The bar is cozy and relaxing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: jeanilb1
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! If you want to experience the true spirit of Key West in style, this is the place. Service was top notch, our room was clean and well furnished, and the ambiance can not be beat! We enjoyed the hassle -free breakfast about four steps out our door every morning, and after cruising all the crazy night spots we relaxed in the lounge to awesome jazz music every night. The breakfast, lunch and dinners were excellent. CLASSY! One tip however; dont try to nap on a Sunday afternoon; the "Tea Dance" is a LOUD PARTY! Dont stay here if you want internet, room service, a gym, or business center. This is FUN place, no work allowed!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQtee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights with my boyfriend and immediately upon arrival we were very pleased with how helpful and welcoming the staff was. It's not a luxury resort but it's an incredible deal for what you get. The room was very quaint, a bit small and outdated but you don't go to key west to spend all day in your room. If you're planning to stay in your room the whole time and spend double the amount a night then choose a resort down the block (southern most resort is beyond gorgeous and also $400 a night) . The pool was nice and relaxing, again, a bit small, but there was no one else around so it was very nice having it all to ourselves. The drinks at the bar are amazing, and cannot rave enough about the FREE breakfast. The location is perfect, you're in the heart of it all but at the nicer, quieter part of town.

Reviews.Title: “charming B&B”
Reviews.Author: missmetroAtlanta_ga
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed. It is so convenient to everything but on the quiet end of Duval. Breakfast is included and very good. Parking can be a bit of a hassle but we always found a spot. The Sunday tea dance is worth the trip to Key West. You can walk or drive to Ft. Zachary State Park. The water is clean and you can snorkle from the beach. Have a evening picnic at Smathers beach but the water there is questionable. You must eat at Blue Heaven at least once while you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jen083
Reviews.Content: Just came back from staying 2 nights here in a standard room. The room was nothing fancy, but it had a king bed, fridge, TV, and was spacious and clean. The bed and pillows were comfy. Breakfast is included at the outdoor restaurant and there was a choice of 3 items. We got the eggs/bacon/potato dish and the french toast, and both were very delicious! The pool in the center court area was great. The location is convenient - close to the Southernmost Point and we walked around one afternoon to the Hemingway House and the Lighthouse Museum. You would have to drive down to the Mallory Sq. side of things, where all the major bars and restaurants are. The hotel has a nice bar and restaurant. We had appetizers at the bar and the food was very good there too. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. No parking is provided at the hotel, but you can park on Catherine St. for free next to the hotel and we had no problem finding parking (note though that we were there during a less busy time).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable hotel with A LOT of character”
Reviews.Author: lin407
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 enjoyable days at La Te Da. The hotel, situated at the quiet end of Duval Street, has lots of character and charm. For a smaller hotel, the layout and amenities are great. There are two bars on the main floor. One is a piano bar with very good entertainment most evenings. The other is a casual bar just off the sidewalk (great for people watching) . The drinks are very good. The restaurant serves very good food, and a full breakfast is included in room prices. The pool was small but adequate, as would be expected in a hotel of this size, but centrally located in the courtyard area. A sun deck was located on the upper level. The rooms were tastefully decorated and the beds were comfortable. We stayed in #23 with a king bed, just off the pool area. The room sizes vary at La Te Da, as we later found out, and some of them are considerably larger than the one we stayed in. A small refrigerator was included, but no safe. The front desk staff was very helpful when we had any questions or concerns. Chris provided us with several good suggestions on things to do in Key West. La Te Da is a short walk to two beaches and about a block from the Key West Butterfly Conservatory (amazing place). The far end of Duval Street (Mallory Square) was a leisurely 15-20 minute walk. We would definitely stay at La Te Da again. We especially liked the comfortable rooms, small size of the hotel, complimentary breakfast, great location, personable staff, and entertainment almost every night.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of a trashy dive”
Reviews.Author: cocteaumazzy
Reviews.Content: Yeah its 180 a night but they don't tell you how the band singers and music shake and yell through the walls all night. Don't plan on a sleepful rest and do not plan on nice bathroom, shower, etc. The plus side is, it is cheap. You get breakfast and the staff is very nice. The pool should not be included as something this hotel offers. It is NOT an inviting pool. The steps leading into are roped off and you have to jump in the deep end. Lots of chipped paint and floors.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Key West! Great location,great staff and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: cy0079
Reviews.Content: This was an absolute steal! We were showed up to our room (#20) and were informed that breakfast was included with our stay. When we got to our room we were pleasantly surprised at the simplicity but comfort of it. The room was spacious and it even had a small veranda. The staff was always friendly and breakfast was delicious. The hotel is at the opposite end of the bustle of Duval Street. It was a great opportunity to walk or bike and see all of Duval. Walking through the other end of Duval I couldn't help to think how hard it would be to try to get some sleep with all the noise. It was great to be able to leave the noise behind after a great night out. The beds are comfortable and going downstairs for breakfast was always a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ktsweets
Reviews.Content: This was my first time going to Key West, and this hotel was recommended by a coworker - it did not disappoint! In fact it was great! The rooms were nice - not fancy, slightly different with not actually having a door to the bathroom (there was one for where the toilet was at least) and a full wall mirror next to the tub! But it had adequate counter space for 3 ladies hair products makeup etc, the room itself was kept very clean by the housekeeping staff, had a nice deck outside that overlooked the pool, it was just very nice overall (we stayed in one of the "luxury" rooms). Only complaint for the room was that there was no iron (with my horrible packing, I only had a few clothes to wear that weren't completely wrinkled!), however my guess is that if we asked the front desk, they probably would have provided one (we just didn't bother). The hotel itself is really cute - you have two bars - one is outside which is really nice, there is a restaurant, a theater, a pool, and the location is perfect. It was really nice being on the "quieter" side of Duval - the pier end is kind of a madhouse (and the hotel is only a 2 minute cab ride or 10 minute walk from there anyways) so it was nice to come back to a relaxed atmosphere. The bartenders are really nice and fun at the hotel, the guy who checked us is was really nice (helped me get my extremely heavy overpacked bag up the steps to the room!) and the hotel has a "gay tea party" on Sundays which was a lot of fun and A LOT of people were there! By the way - it does not seem to be strictly a "gay" hotel - there were lots of couples there/groups of people (I went w/ my mom, sister and husband - we all loved the place)All of this and the price was really really reasonable! I mean when we were trying to find hotels originally (before the recommendation) we were suprised by how pricey the other hotel prices were! Overall, Key West was fun, a bit exhausting (bars don't close until 4 or 5am which definately added to the exhaustion) so I don't know if I'll be going back anytime soon, but I'd definately recommend this hotel to anyone who would be going down there! (I've attached some pictures, however the only ones I have are from the outside of room, I didn't take pictures of the actual room or restaurant/bar)

Reviews.Title: “Had a La Te Da time”
Reviews.Author: bigceiling
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. Stayed with my wife on our first time to Key West. Room was plesant and clean. The hotel is located on the south end of Duval St. and walking is a must if you want to hit the action. The nice part is that when you want to leave the action you are still on Duvall street. We loved the room except for no coffee maker and windows are old and cracked. The breakfast that is included in room price is top notch as is all their food and drinks, We will stay again, great staff, great atmosphere. Thanks for the memories. Peace

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Choice”
Reviews.Author: FussyCosmo
Reviews.Content: This is a cute and unique small hotel and the friendly staff really sets them apart. The rooms are somewhat basic but comfortable, the pool is heated, the complementary breakfast generous and the cabaret show is wonderful! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, excellent food, rooms need some TLC”
Reviews.Author: LimeyFlorida
Reviews.Content: stayed at LaTeDa for a vacation in July, service was excellent, staff was very friendly, great breakfast included with room, would recommend restaurant, place has lots of character and is located on the south side of Duval Street, not as noisy as the north side, had fun at the Cabaret, rooms need some TLC, bldg. is over 100 years old so we didn't expect an immaculate room but furniture was old and headboard was crumbling, beware if you are a nonsmoker - all rooms are smoking and cigar smoking is big here, room did not smell, but cigar and cigarette smoking is big at pool and bar area

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: uncleroyhobbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LaTeDa June 27th-June 29th and had a great time! Booked through Travelocity and when we arrived, were upgraded to a luxury room (#28) on the 2nd floor. Room was very nice & hugh! A/C worked fine, but did run constantly. Service from check in to check out was excellent! Much better than we are accustomed to in south Florida. Breakfast was very good and again, the service, excellent! Pool was smaller than it appears on the website, but refreshing! Would not hesitate to stay here again! Had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good Guesthouse, but needs more to be the top”
Reviews.Author: NJGirlSeeingtheWorld
Reviews.Content: My recommendation to any review reader is to take into account when the reviewer stayed at La Te Da. We stayed from Memorial Day (May 25th) through May 29th. This is the quiet season in Key West. There were only about 4 to 5 other couples staying at the house with us. Room We stayed in Room 27, which faces out to the pool on the first floor. It is nicely furnished and the room was clean. If you are one to look at details (like I am), there are things that need upkeep. For example, there was a gap at the top of our room door. And with the mosquitoes all around Key West, you donâ€™t want to give them access to your room. The room could use a paint job. Pool One of the previous reviews were dead on- there is cat hair ALL OVER the pool lounge chairs. There are two cats that live at the guesthouse and meander about the pool, restaurant and kitchen areas. If you get Room 27, you have two Adirondack chairs on your mini patio so you donâ€™t have to use the lounge chairs. There is also a sundeck at the top of the house, which is clothing optional and has chairs without cat hair. Bar & Restaurant The room rate includes daily breakfast, which is served from 8:30am-10:30am. There are three breakfast options, and includes coffee and juice. The options are good starters for the day. We had dinner there one evening, which was very good. Portions arenâ€™t big for the prices, but full of flavor. The bar faces Duval, so it is great for people watching. The bartenders are friendly and the bar atmosphere is fun. Location Like other reviewers have said, it is on the quiet end of Duval. If you are a walker (like my husband and I are), you will have no problem getting from one end of Duval to the other. Recommendations -Check out the Ernest Hemingway House (best house to tour in Key West). -Check out Shipwreck Museum (for interesting Key West history). -Go to Danteâ€™s on Caroline Street- half price raw bar from 4-8pm. -Go see the sunset at Top Bar (on rooftop) at the Crown Plaza on Duval. -Make the effort to walk down to the marina- a bunch of untouched restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Brunswick1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our wedding. My mom loved this place so much. She bought a shirt the day we left. The rooms are homey, and tropical. The property is beautiful, but the pool is not very welcoming because it's right next to the restaurant. The breakfast (included with the hotel stay) is delicious. The breakfast staff is attentive. Would stay again? Yes, because we stayed there for our wedding. Yes, even if we didn't stay there for our wedding.

Reviews.Title: “La Te Da... home away from home”
Reviews.Author: corkymaria
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here rather than our usual spot because of the great rate and I had always thought it looked cute on previous trips to Key West. In short, we'll probably never stay anywhere else again... it was absolutely perfect! The staff are super friendly. (Big hugs to Robin from Corey and Robert... and Gregg... you're missing me, right?) The room was lovely. The hotel and grounds are perfectly "Key West." If you want to actually see Key West, you might reconsider staying here because you'll never want to leave the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “find someplace else to go”
Reviews.Author: bigmighty
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife for a meal and the cabaret.What a let down.The food was lukewarm and the service was dreadful.The overpriced show was also disappointing.Randy Roberts performed for one hour 5 minutes and at least 10 minutes of that time was whilst he changes and the audience were left to watch videos.His patter was unfunny and we got the impression that it was all a chore to him.AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at La Te Da”
Reviews.Author: ias731
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Te Da for three days in January. The location was great, on the quiet end of Duval. The reception was welcoming. When we arrive there was a "tea" party happening which was playing great music. We were in a king room on the second floor in the front of the hotel. All in all the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “La Te Da in need of some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Narrabeam
Reviews.Content: We have visited Key West many times in the past & have always enjoyed the bars at La Te Da. This year we decided to stay here. This was a huge dissappointment. The room was not very clean when we arrived & all cleaning was cursory. We had to beg reception for toilet paper for 3 days as none were left for us. The telephone remained u/s for our entire 10 night stay. The outdoor lights to the room were also u/s as were the lights up the steps to the room. We weere plagued with mosquitos in the room, killing about 20-30 each day & left covered in bites. All the sun loungers & patio chairs were covered in cat hairs, even though they do not accept pets, their own cats are all over the place, I also observed the cats going into & out of the kitchen. The kitchen doors are wide open all day with no fly screen in place. Pool towel service was erratic, somedays we got 3 towels, other days only 1. Hot water for showers was random too, we had to have several cold showers. The pool was difficult to use as the shallow end steps are roped off as it borders the restaurant. Access is via very sharp steep steps straight into the deep end & the pool floor is all flakey & needs repairing. The clothing option sundeck is via a rickety rusty staircase, where you find the most uninviting sun terrace I have ever seen. La Te Da tries to be a Bar, Restaurant & a hotel, but whilst the bars are pretty good places to go, the hotel part falls well short of acceptable standards. I would not recommend this place as a good place to stay. We were throughly disappointed, many of the issues were raised with hotel reception, but nothing was done about any of them. Worst place I ever stayed in Key West. La Te Da hotel is in desperate need of some TLC to bring it up to standard, this means improving hygiene, cleanliness & customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: jackalope76
Reviews.Content: We arrived several hours before the designated check-in, and were allowed to check in immediately. The staff was extremely friendly, and helped us up to the room with our luggage. We were in room 21, which I will request the next time we stay at La Te Da. The room was nicely decorated, and had a small shaded balcony seating area overlooking the outside hotel bar/restaurant. The location on duval is ideal because it is on the quieter end of the street. Each night we did go to bars and restaurants further up the street, but it was nice to be able to relax at the hotel without all of the bar noise. Breakfast (included in room price) was great and made to order each morning until 10:30 am. We thoroughly enjoyed staying at the La Te Da, and will without question stay there again on our next trip. Couldn't have asked for a more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “great fun”
Reviews.Author: mickm23
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Key West, where we stayed at La Te Da for 5 nights. We had room 27, right at the end of the pool, with a great little porch, perfect spot to start the day and end the night! Hot and humid, which brought out the bugs, but they took care of that right away for us. Loved that the pool was 24/7,nice to come back after a really hot day in town and jump in the pool to cool off, especially really late at night. I cannot say enough about the staff here, they were amazing, everyone was so friendly, and made sure that everything was ok. Free breakfast was what everyone said it would be, and much better than anywhere else we have stayed. The Sunday brunch buffet was an experience not to be missed. Wednesday prime rib night is fabulous! Even if you don't stay here, you have to come eat here, you will not be disappointed! Chef Alice, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jwey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we heard the restaurant was wonderful. It was. This small hotel is located on the quiet side of Duval Street. The rooms aren't fancy, but well priced and comfortable. If you are on the uptight side, let it be known that several times a month they host "tea dances." These are not your mother's get togethers. Suffice it to say my husband was a bit surprised to be handed a lei by a six foot seven inch bikini clad person with a deep voice. We enjoyed the outside bar that looked out on Duval. The cooked to order breakfast included with our room was terrific!!! Overall, we had a wonderful stay. The only negative is the lack of parking. We luckily found a parking space on a side street.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: GILOLeeds
Reviews.Content: I honestly haven't got a bad thing to say about this beautiful hotel. Our room was clean, nicely decorated and well proportioned. Staff were extremely helpful. The free breakfast was great and there was a good selection to choose from. The pool was small but we had it to ourselves every day of our holiday. The location of the hotel was perfect for us (young married couple). We knew that we wanted to be on Duvall street but preferred to be on the quieter end, a 10 minute stroll to the nightlife. I would recommend this hotel to anyone of a similar age or older.

Reviews.Title: “Home away From Home”
Reviews.Author: swebb77
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got there it was a feeling of comfort. They knew our name when we walked in the door and helped us carry our heavy bags up the stairs only to refuse a tip! I made her take it anyhow! The drinks were great, they bought us shots and told us the great things to do while we were there. Make sure you find the Kenos facotry near mallory square!! I have told everyone about our great time and reccomend you try this great little gem on Duvall Street!!

Reviews.Title: “Real Key West flavor!”
Reviews.Author: tlynntex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the La Te Da Hotel, June 19th through the 22nd. We had a great experience! The hotel had a little bit of everything that we like. The outdoor bar and restaurant were wonderful, and breakfast was included. We had a beautifully decorated room on the 2nd floor with double French doors to the terrace, and a huge shower. On our first morning there, I went to the restaurant in a desperate search for coffee. It was early, and the coffee wasn't quite ready, but within 10 minutes, there was a tray of coffee on the table on our terrace right outside our door, and it was there each morning after that. I loved it! What great service! Location was perfect. We could walk to just about any place that we wanted, and Duval Street is a lot of fun. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: utcyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one weekend and enjoyed the property. The staff is wonderful. Laurel was so friendly and made you feel at home. At any time, if we needed something or any assistance she would do her best to help us. Key West is great and lots of fun. Perfect vacation and the hotel was very nice for the price! We are a straight couple and it definitely wasn't obnoxious. Breakfast was a big plus. The music and entertainment was not loud - it appeared to be a lot of fun. The bartenders were very nice and friendly. We had a great time fishing, scuba diving and eating. We had dinner at Louie's Backyard - delicious. We fished with www.thinktarpon.com and had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved our day”
Reviews.Author: klein3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for memorial day long weekend and had a great stay. The staff was very friendly and gave us lots of good advice on where to eat, places to see, etc. We had room 28, nice and spacious and away from the breakfast/dining area so was very quiet. We enjoyed the clothing optional sundeck as well. It is a 5-10 min walk to where a lot of the bars and restaurants start but we liked like the walking and it was very quiet around our place when we deicded to go to bed. Parking was very easy to find on the side street. Overall a very good stay and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the La Te Da!”
Reviews.Author: patinkin23
Reviews.Content: The staff was very warm and accomadating, the room was quaint and very clean, and the pool was right outside our room - very convenient. The Tea Dance on Sunday was hilarious - despite the abrupt arrival and departure of a man and woman who were clearly uncomfortable with men dancing with each other. I was really surprised to see anyone in Key West look so freaked about anyone's behavior! I have to admit, walking past all the diners to come and go did take some getting used to, but it was really no big deal. And the walk to all the true nonsense on Duval was a little long - but I think that had more to do with the heat and poor choice of flip flops.
