Oh yeah, and the 4 million cocktails may have caused some trouble walking... All in all I'd have to recommend the La Te Da - and Key West in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Eaglesfan20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Key West for the first time and decided to stay at La Te Da based on all the positive reviews we had seen. Like a previous poster, we were greeted by name upon arrival at the front desk before checking in. We were shown to our room, a deluxe room right next to the pool. The room had plenty of size for two people on vacation. King bed, dresser and closet piece, couple sitting chairs and a small refrigerator. Our room had a throw rug down on the floor covering what felt like broken tiles underneath, but certainly nothing to complain about. The bed was comfortable, the room kept a good temperature, and never had any problems with any noise from the pool area or the bar. The breakfast vouchers you receive every morning are a huge plus. Its a choice of like three meals - eggs/bacon, french toast, or fruit platter (maybe something else too). The food is out of the restaurant and excellent, nothing like a mass produced cafeteria style meal. We relaxed at the bar at the end of the night a couple of times and enjoyed talking with the different bartenders and patrons. As a straight couple in our late twenties, we never felt out of place. The staff was very friendly and extremely accomodating, trying to make sure you had the best vacation possible. The hotel is located on the quiet side of Duval which was nice, but was certainly close enough to walk to the other end with no complaints. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: marteen0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another couple for 3 nights in March 2008, and also in Jan. 2007. All straights. The place has a great ambience, for us at least. There was always something going on at the bar, which is situated perfectly right on Duval. We enjoyed being on the quiet end of town. In 07 we brought a car - parking on side streets not too much of a hassle. Service/staff are tops, of course. Beach is a couple blocks down the street. A somewhat hidden treasure on that end of the island is the White Street pier - the city has made it a monument to AIDS victims. Only drawback is the price - if you are just looking for a place to crash this is not it. You need to spend some time there to take it in.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but a Fraud!”
Reviews.Author: shannat11172
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually stay at the hotel but booked a bachelorette party for the drag show upstairs. We purchased the tickets and arrived well before the 10pm start time. When we arrived there we were told by the door staff that we were to behave because they have no problem kicking bachelorette parties out. We are a very good looking group of girls in our late 20's, and were dressed very respectful. At first I didn't think anything of it, until three days later when I saw my bank statement. The hotel charged me and 8 others (that have been confirmed, I am still waiting to hear from 2 others) each 3 times, each for different totals. When we split the bill we gave the girl 10 cards to split the bill, which totaled $255.00. We had asked her to split it per person but were told there was no way and that one of us should foot the whole bill and get out money back from the other girls. We ended up splitting it 10 ways, and each of us were brought a credit slip that was charged $27. (which totaled $20 more than the original bill). However when I checked my account today I was charged almost $300. And the other girls were also charged amounts totaling amounts similar. When I called them they dismissed the information and asked why I was calling and didnt just get the information from the other girls who were already calling and bugging them. Needless to say, I will not be returning. There are plenty of other drag shows in Key West to see

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the G&T's”
Reviews.Author: JennyB5000
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner (straight couple) have recently returned home from almost two weeks in South Florida. We found La Te Da on this site, liked the reviews and decided to book a standard room. We arrived on the Sunday afternoon to be greeted by loud 80's music. Managed to find a parking space on the side street and checked in. We were greeted by friendly staff and were also upgraded to room 20. After dragging our cases thorough the middle of the tea dance party, which finishes at just gone 6pm, we found our room, large, comfortable, clean and airy. I had concerns that being so close to the cabaret and over the bar the room would be noisy. However, the cabaret finishes before 10.30pm and the bar entertainment is too far away to be much of a concern. The breakfast was a bonus as we were expecting to pay. The drinks were a little pricey but they were also huge (if youâ€™re from the UK you are used to tiny shots). We ate in the restaurant once and found it in line with the other restaurants in Key West. The â€˜Broads of Broadwayâ€™ cabaret was very entertaining, although I do agree with other reviewers that the â€˜minimum 2 drinkâ€™ requirement is a bit off putting. We were made aware of it beforehand and therefore didnâ€™t drink too much with our meal. All in all, a great hotel situated in the quiet end of Duval Street. Go and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, would probably go back”
Reviews.Author: smile9922
Reviews.Content: We are a straight couple and flew into Miami and drove to key west and didn't realize their was not any parking at the hotel but were able to find a spot within a block or two. I was greated by name upon checkin only to find out i was the only female checking in that day, which had me concerned. I need not have been their were all types of couples staying at the hotel , both straight and gay and the other patrons as well as staff were friendly and respectful. The room was clean and very nice. The free breakfast was a terrific perk and was always very good and the wait staff was wonderful...however we did have a not so memorable dinner and rude waitress one night. We chose not so see the show due mostely to other reviews. I would definately stay here again, but I here the hotel can get a little wild during certain times of the year and certain celebrations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic get away with a fun staff”
Reviews.Author: jad640
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for the first time for our 21st Anniversary. We are a straight couple in our mid 40's and were treated wonderfully for the entire week we stayed there. The staff, Robin, Mindy,Gina, April and Linda, to Hard pouring Jersey Mark, Matty, the Jasons, Doug, Damien, Kory, Johnny and who ever else We forgot, were very courteous, friendly and professional to us. Our room had a few flaws, but I guess for the amount of time spent there, was not that big of a deal, but for the price we payed, should be improved. The food was better than average and very consistent. We ate the included breakfast there some mornings, but also ventured out to some of the more popular recommended spots. Never had a bad meal anywhere all week. The beaches are ok, and we tried them all, but ended spending most of our time at the Southern most mansion's pool. We rented a scooter for the week which was fun to do our morning errands and sightseeing. I would definitely stay at La Te Da again. Catch a show there, and also check out there nightly entertainment, all very good. Hi, to every we met down there...John and Gerry

Reviews.Title: “unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: thindy
Reviews.Content: I recently went to your show and was extremely verbally abused by you restaurant manager. We were sitting at our table watching the show and one of my friends was taking pictures and whispering to me when he approached our table stating "tell you friend to SHUT UP or we will throw you out". I had to turn and ask him what he said to me as I was shocked at his unprofessional behavior, he repeated it again. I stood up and informed my friends that we were leaving and they soon followed right behind us. I didnt witness what was told to me by them that he followed them downstairs yelling/screaming and cussing at them. We had only been there about 15 mins into the start of your show. I must say that I will be telling all my friends to stay away and if they want to see a great show go to the 801, least you can have a good time there...also will never set foot in your place again and going to advise all my friends to do the same. I think you need to review how your staff treats the customers, its EXTREMELY unprofessional. I know I would not still be working there if I was him.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blowe99
Reviews.Content: Don't go to the show. The staff is rude and not helpfull. Stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed La Te Da”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBurnham
Reviews.Content: First trip to Key West for this straight couple in their 60's. La Te Da staff were very helpful and friendly, including management, front desk, bartenders, wait staff. Breakfast coupons brought the price down by about $20, and there were several good choices. Relaxed atmosphere. Pool was inviting but weather a bit too cool. Staff had good suggestions for activities and places to eat. We ate one dinner at La Te Da and it was very good. We also enjoyed the cabaret. Room was clean and spacious. Room 18 is right next to the bar, but noises subsided about 11 each evening. Whirlpool tub (for 2) ran out of hot water on the first filling, so we learned to fill it half way, then wait another 30 minutes for more hot water. We will certainly go back when we return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon at La Te Da!”
Reviews.Author: newlywed112307
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our Key West honeymoon. We stayed at La Te Da for the entire trip and had a fabulous experience. When we arrived Sean upgraded us to a luxury room, free of cost (room 20). He then sat down with us and went over the map of Key West and told us all of his favorite sites and restaurants. We took his advice on all of his suggestions and did not have one bad meal. We loved the breakfast every morning. It was so filling that we didn't have to buy lunch while we were there. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The staff at La Te Da was extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was there right now”
Reviews.Author: brettdt3
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for anything better. As soon as we arrived we were upgraded for no reason at all. We went during July so it was extremely hot. The pool was by far the coolest place to be on the whole island. We spent hours there. Doug and Matty are the best bartenders ever. I forgot to write this review, but remembered to now because Doug called us to wish us a happy thanksgiving! The food is awesome. It was by far my favorite dinner of the whole trip. We met a lot of other couples while staying there who loved there stay too. You have got to go to the tea party on Sundays. Don't be too uptight and enjoy the drag queens. The only problem we had was that there were some small ants in our bathroom. I just sprayed them with some hairspray and they died. No need to complain or let it ruin our trip, besides, we were in key west for god sakes! Oh yea...we met the owner one day. He is awesome. He brought us free drinks by the pool, gave us free shirts, and told us a great time to come back down. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and would absolutely come back!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ladell8
Reviews.Content: This Place ROCKS!!! First off, the Staff greets you by name! They totally make you feel at home. One of the better places to people watch is at the outside terrace Bar. All of the Bartenders know thier stuff and can teach you a thing or two about the drink you thought you knew! The Staff is UBER friendly and just full of information. Anytime we needed a quick place to go and grab a bite to eat with the HUGE Crowd we were traveling with...they made the best suggestions and then were always on hand to find out if it went well! They are just awesome. Having a 24hr Clothing optional pool doesn't hurt either! Nothing like Night Swimming after a sweltering Summer Day. Did I mention the rooms were spacious and just a relaxing retreat. Not only will my Husband and I return to this hotel in the future..so will most of my family! My only regret was not catching the show! Well there is always next time! To Sean, Doug, Jeff, and Kim, YOu ARE TRULY the BEST.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest Hotel in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: dhartman50
Reviews.Content: In early May, 2007, i spent my twentyfirst vacation in Key West. My tenth at La Te Da. Words alone can't possibly describe the La Te Da experience. The hotel is the perfect size, with beautiful guest rooms. The property is well kept. Clean and inviting. The staff is the friendliest on the island. Attentive and accommodating. The hotel boasts a casual elegance that few can pull off. Those dressed up for dinner mix well with those in flip-flops that haven't gotten off their bar-stools since breakfast. The cabaret is one of the island's crown jewels. Just campy enough to make it fun. Lots of fun! The hotel has two bars - The outdoor bar is a great place for people watching and enjoying the best Mimosa you'll ever have. I've stayed at several hotels on Key West, and now that I've found La Te Da, I'll never have to look again. -David

Reviews.Title: “I'm Hooked”
Reviews.Author: RNKR
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive reviews. I had a great time at this hotel. Relaxed and casual with what I consider an old Key West atmosphere. I found all the workers friendly and willing to help. One day Doug the bartender threw a big bucket of ice in the pool and then made us all mango Margarita's on the house while we floated around. I went to this hotel solo but felt I was never without friends. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Te Da”
Reviews.Author: IndyBois
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience, everyone was great and also a great mix of people....The rooms are nice, bathrooms need a little updating(clean, just older) and a little better air conditioning(it was extremely hot in KW that week) but minor issues..it is everything thing you expect from Key West and more.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed La Te Da”
Reviews.Author: mateo1380
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a two night stay at La Te Da. We really enjoyed the location of the hotel on the quiet end of Duval St. with boutique shops and art galleries right across the street. The staff was very friendly throughout our stay from the moment we arrived. Our room was a standard king room which was at the back of the property on the second level. I would definitely want to stay in a second level room as it seemed more private than the rooms surrounding the pool. The room was large and clean with basic furnishings. I believe some of the more expensive rooms had better furniture and we may try one of those next time, but for this trip it was fine. The one thing that really needed updating was the bathroom. In some pictures on here it seemed the bathroom had been renovated, but not in ours. It reminded us of a public bathroom. Also, there is no central air, but the window A/C worked fine although it was loud. The pool and courtyard of the property is very nice, and though we didn't use the pool this time, at most times we could have had the pool to ourselves. The breakfast, although limited in choices, was good and if we had stayed longer would have probably gone to the restaurant for dinner. Even though the room could use updating, we will probably stay at the La Te Da again on our next visit to Key West. Two tips: you don't need to bring an alarm or have a wake-up call made: the roosters woke us up every day! Go to the Butterfly Conservatory which is a block away on Duval. It was our favorite tourist attraction we did there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: poodlegirl777
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 5 night stay at La Te Da. Although it is a mostly gay property, they were very accommodating to a straight couple. This was our first time to Key West and all of the staff at La Te Da were very helpful to us with tips and suggestions of things to do and see. The hotel is located at the "calm" end of Duval Street. Key West is very much a "party town" and we could hear the fun going on until late in the evening. It did not bother us, though. We highly recommend this clean, lovely, place for anyone to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: skinny74
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four night stay at La Te Da and we had a very nice time. We had a second floor "luxury" room in the back area of the property. The room seemed to be recently updated and the bed was very comfortable. The thing that made our visit an enjoyable stay was the staff and the other guests, everyone was very helpful and extremely friendly. The pool is very small with only a few lounge chairs available but it was never crowded. Having never been to KW, my husband and I did a lot of site seeing so we spent most afternoons out and about on the island. The food at the restaurant was very good and the drinks at the bar were great. The location was ideal for seeing the Old Town area of KW. The only thing that we noticed that needs improvement would be some of the regular maintenance such as painting banisters, tile work, etc. All in all, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: trixieloulou
Reviews.Content: The best thing about La Te Da is the staff. From the time we arrived to the time we left every staff member we encountered was extremely friendly and more than helpful. They made our experience. The second best thing about La Te De was the restaurant. The food was amazing. We opted to order breakfast off of their menu instead of taking advantage of the free breakfast offered with the stay. That was our choice because they had so many wonderful choices. As well we had lunch, dinner and drinks. Everytime was better than the last. The rooms are very much like a B&B and have great charm. Unfortunately the small air conditioning units in the rooms are not sufficient to keep the room cool. The TV's have limited channels and do not always work. We never complained so maybe this is something they could have fixed. If you like B&B's this hotel is more than perfect!!!!!! If you prefer modern ammenties than you will be disappointed. For our next trip we will visit La Te Da for drinks and meals but will stay in a more modern hotel. It's not because La Te Da is a bad place to stay, It's because we like a more modern stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, you will hate it!”
Reviews.Author: funky102
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be my most favorite in Key West. I used to stay there the MANY times that I went, however, this was the WORST EXPERIENCE that I could have possibly had. Because of a recent change in management, staff is absolutely dreadful. The rooms were extremely dirty and I actually saw bugs in the room, dirty linens, ring around the tub, a smell of mold in the room and terribly uncomfortable beds. There was a USED condom in one of the fake plants in my room. It was TOTALLY disgusting. We ate at the restaurant and the food was the worst I have EVER eaten in the Keys. I really don't think this place is going to last long the way they are operating now. Also, the Mexican bartender in the tiny little inside bar made a pass at me and it sickened me. I mentioned all of the above to the manager but it didn't seem to phase him. I felt only way to get restitution was to let fellow travellers know what an ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE PLACE THIS IS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Establishment!”
Reviews.Author: TNTNJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-day stay at La Te Da. What we can offer from our stay is nothing short of fantastic. As ALL places in an island resort area, of course they could use a little updating, but as many people have already said, who goes there to spend every minute in the room? The important thing is that the rooms were spotless, and if you needed anything the staff was more than accommodating to make sure you received it. Mark has done an excellent job of finding and retaining some of the best staff that Key West has to offer. Every single person there was friendly and outgoing. The pool does have a little debris from the tree's above, there were people on hand several times a day to remove the leaves, but impossible to manage full time. The pool is private, and is 24 hours. It is heated and feels great at 2 am! We had breakfast and dinner at La Te Da. For breakfast we tried the free meals, which were great. But we also tried the breakfast special one morning, which was delicious. The dinner setting was romantic and the food was prepared perfectly. We ordered specials as well as from the menu (There were 6 of us). Everyone loved his or her food. Our waiter even went the extra mile to accommodate a drink my wife loves. They didnâ€™t have all of the ingredients on hand, but he made sure she received it. We probably had the most fun with the bar staff. We started our afternoons with drinks at the bar. The bartender was extremely funny/friendly, and made great drinks too! We were told that their Bloody Marys are all home made, but we never had a chance to try one. The La Te Da Lemonade is a great summer drink, and the martiniâ€™s come with a very generous â€œside-carâ€� all of which make for the perfect start of a day. The only negative that we could say about this place is that walking from the hotel to the bars at the other side of the island does get a bit tiring. This problem could be solved by just drinking there, taking a cab, or scooters downtown etc. We would no doubt only stay at La Te Da the next time we visit Key West. We could not imagine staying somewhere else. (We have been to Key West 3 times total, this is the first review we have written.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: ckdjr60301
Reviews.Content: Sure, it's not the Four Seasons, but in many ways, better. The rooms were clean. They were in need or renovation, but, really. One doesn't go to Key West to sit in a hotel room all day. It was small, quaint, clean and friendly. The bar was nice, the pool was nice and the restaurant was nice. I had a great, relaxing time at this hotel. The people were wonderful. This property is not child friendly, which makes it even better. It is located in a quieter area of Duval. Relaxing at the pool, one would never know that you are just steps from a main thoroughfare. I do look forward to many, many returns to La Te Da.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MHWK
Reviews.Content: We staid at the La Te Da after we had read all these other reviews on Tripadvisor and after we had heard about it from friends, but after having been there in person, we were disappointed. We had a superior room, which was one of the best rooms in the entire hotel. The room was equipped with a swamp cooler that barely lowered the temperature in the room. The bathrooms are out of date and needed a remodelling already 20 years ago. The pool is dirty and needs repairs, and so do other public areas of the hotel. The staff wear dirty pants and shirts. The rate came with a breakfast included, but the breakfast is not prepared very lovingly. Eggs and toast are served diner-style, and there is no menu to purchase additional items. Summary: too expensive for what is on offer, seems run-down. We will not go back there, which is sad.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay for Us”
Reviews.Author: carr49
Reviews.Content: We have made a "trek" to Key West at least once a year since 1985. For a long time, we thought a water-front stay was a must, but we got to know La-Te-Da initially through stops along Duval for dinner or a bar visit. When a wait staff member told us the owners felt that the hotel's policy was guests were to be comfortable, whether they were there to write a book, just relax, eat and drink, tan on the "optional" deck, get a feel for old Key West, etc., well, that's what they are there for! And it's true, we wouldn't be happy anywhere else. And cheers! to bartender Mark!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome adult resort!”
Reviews.Author: jesinjax
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the La Te Da. It is definitely for adults only. We took full advantage of the 24 hour pool. Our room was nothing special, but in Key West, you don't spend your time in your room! The restaurant was very good as well. The staff was very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Bumpkins
Reviews.Content: We (two women) stayed two nights Jan 24 and 25 2007. Had a room with two queen beds just off the dining area. Bathroom was huge, shower only, great for wheelchair access or limited mobility if needed. Only complaint was that the AC had to work really hard to keep the room relatively cool. Staff was wonderful, breakfast was included and was delicious; went to the show upstairs in the cabaret one night and then had dinner and enjoyed both. More like a B&B, no children allowed, old world charm. Not for anyone who wants a cookie cutter Hilton room in a highrise. Romantic dining, fun in the bar at night, walked 2 minutes to the Old Town Trolley for our tour around Key West. Easy to find a spot off street for parking and never moved the car for two days. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: channell44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the La Te Da Hotel in Key West in mid-January. I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. From the excellent breakfast to the comfortable bed this place is phenomenal. From the moment we stepped foot on the property the staff was more than accomodating. Everyone was friendly and continually asked what we had did and if we needed any help with finding something else to do. This hotel is well worth the price. I will stay at this hotel the next time I am in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Part of my Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jrep
Reviews.Content: I just got back from one of the best vacations I have ever had and a major part of why it was so wonderful was because of our stay at the La Te Da Hotel. Our stay was over the weekend of the 12th through the 15th of Janruary of 2007. I decided to book this hotel after reading some of the reviews both on here and on the hotel's web site and then after talking to one of the night managers and hearing professionalism and warmth in his voice instantly, it was a no brainer to choose this place. The website also has a very cool video presentation that showcased the property and everything on the video was true to life the minute we jumped out of the car and walked up Duval and into the hotel to check in. I cant begin to tell you how this hotel affected our vacation down there. We originally had booked for two nights (a friday and saturday) and decided to stay through sunday instead of driving back to Miami. The hotel has 15 rooms and though we only stayed in one and our friend in another...if all the rooms were half as nice as ours...I cant imagine anyone not having as wonderful a time as we did. The hotel manager (Danial) was nothing short of amazing in his friendliness and hospitality and in his professionalism. He was always willing to help us with whatever we might have needed (and I am told I am very high maintance to begin so I am sure i was not the easiest guest to take care of) and without missing a beat. That kind of experience went on with the entire staff from beginning to end. The hotel also has a wonderful little restaurant that sits open air overlooking the pool and the many porches and terraces that make up the complex. The tables are dressed in white linen and nice china and stemware and there is a centerpiece of fresh pink roses in glass vases on each table. It is a true courtyard enviroment and the restaurant lends itself to an "old world bistro" type feel that is so authentic and relaxing that one could sit there for hours. There is a bar, which is also open air and is situated right next to the street and flows into the restaurant. It has caberet tables as well as a few stools for those who want to sit at the bar. There is also an indoor lounge with a piano that gets some decent traffic at night. The restaurant staff (Jimmie, our server all three mornings and Juan the service assistant in particular) was all top notch and gave us the most personalised and efficient service I have ever recieved anywhere ever, and 500 % more than we had recieved during our whole time in Florida. The breakfasts, which were included with the stay,(the hotel gives you a voucher every morning with different selections to choose from) were very tasty and filling (a french toast to die for on one day and eggs and bacon with toast on the others) and included coffee and juice and everything was perfectly prepared each time. I needed coffee to take up to our room on both mornings before coming down to breakfast, and our favorite server Jimmie set up a tray with cups and coffee and cream on the spot...I was wowed to say the least. I wanted to take her back home to work for me in my restaurant. We didn't eat dinner there but during our stay I noticed many people dining and I talked to one lady and she commented on how tasty everything was. The menu seemed to offer a little bit of everything. I had the pleasure of meeting the chef one morning and I complimented her on her food and professional craftmanship with the menu. The bartenders were always friendly and always had a story or two to tell, along with the best bloody marys in town and were always right on the ball. One in particular, Jason, was a "quintesential armchair psycitarist" and always had his ear ready to be bent by anyone wanting to unload their problems on him....which it seemed a few did. While we didnt get a chance to take in any of the caberet shows while we were there, I did notice quite a few people coming in off the street for the classy entertainment eminating from the lounge. The voices of the singer and the guy on the piano accompyning her made for a very "drawn in" experience...you could see the people walking in off the street just because of the vibe that was being heard just inside the hotel. During our stay we frequently commented on how nice it was to be on Duval street which is where all the shops and the nightlife are. The hotel is located is towards the southernmost end, which is a bit away from all the traffic and most of the shops and that made it peacefull and quiet but at the same time a very easy walk to all the shopping, food and nightlife. It was almost as if the hotel was a little hideaway from the rest of the hustle and bustle of that famous street. The hotel is also only a few blocks from some very nice beaches and beachside pools that are parts of other complexes at the end of Duval street. At most of those resorts, one can rent a chair on the beach or by the hotel for $6.00 a day. A few have clothing optional areas if one if up for that as well. Our room was wonderful as well. Just perfect. Fresh and clean and what some would probably consider a little dated but just right. It had a true "Banana Republic feel" to it. We had a luxery room with a king size bed on the second floor towards the back of the hotel, overlooking the pool. Two sets of french doors and windows both in the room and the bathroom brought in the perfect amount of light and being on the 2nd floor in back, just up the stairs from the pool deck made us feel both secluded and part of the action at the same time. The bed was very comfy with an overstuffed mattress and though we didnt sleep much, we did manage to take quite a few power naps here and there. The room was nicely appointed with a big closet and dresser and tv with mutliple selections available. The bathroom had a nice size jacuzzi, which doubles as the shower (with floor to ceiling mirrors on the wall of the tub) and a decent sized dressing area by the sink. We also had a resident cat named Henry who snoozed on the porch in front of our room or on one of the wicker chairs just in front of the other room that shared our porch....and that alone was an at home feeling one doesnt get a chance to experience that often. The (clothing optional) sundeck on the roof was a perfect place for a lazy morning of sun and reading and so private but yet open. You can see all the way to the southernmost point of the island from the roof and watch people coming and going up and down Duval street at all hours of the day. I could have spent an entire month of sunny days up there. Everyone remembered our names from the get go and that alone made us feel so welcome and at home that we didn't want to leave (sort of like the old Cheer's song...where everyone knows your name) and talked about our stay the entire trip back from the Keys to Wisconsin. We will surly stay at the La Te Da again when down in Key West and will reccomend it to our friends and others without the least bit of hesitation. If anyone wants to experience the true feeling of what Key West used to be and still should be then they should spend a few days at the La Te Da. These folks know how to do hospitality right. And that is a rather hard thing to find these days. A very satisfied guest from Racine Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “A great evening at La Te Da!”
Reviews.Author: petlady1
Reviews.Content: There are reviews of this as a hotel already on this site, but we didn't stay there, we just went for the entertainment. They have a drag show most nights, upstairs in one of the cabaret theaters. It was wonderful! There were 2 guys in drag, one a Harvey Fierstein type, the other much prettier than me and many girls I know, and the third guy was the straight man. The first half of the show, they did songs and jokes. No lip-synching here. They all sang with their own voices, and they were great. The second half was a greatly sped-up version of "The Sound of Music," with the two "girls" playing all the female parts, and the straight man doing the male parts. We laughed til we cried. Well worth every penny we spent and the two obligatory drinks (which were also good). I wondered about the audience, but there were all kinds of people there, and even a small dog who accompanies a regular everywhere she goes, and everyone had a fantastic time. After the show, we went downstairs to the bar and lounge, also very nice, and listened to Debra, the singer, and her husband Patrick, the pianist. They were also amazing entertainers. All in all, a great evening! Go! You won't be sorry!!

Reviews.Title: “Oodles of Charm”
Reviews.Author: PrivyChamber
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: This was our third trip to Old Town Key West. So far, the La-te-da is our favorite hotel. I believe it is named after a Cuban politician. It has wonderful Key West ambiance and â€˜people watchingâ€™ from the bar is splendid. THE GOOD: Great atmosphere, large, clean room, fabulous staff and excellent location. The music they played in the lounge was terrific and comprised light jazz and stuff from the 20â€™s 30â€™s and 40â€™s. We loved it. It was quite refreshing from the pounding volume of the other drinking establishments farther up the street. A continental breakfast is available and if you want to spend all morning drinking free coffee, the staff will be happy to chat as little or as much as you like. WiFi is no charge and is available in the bar/breakfast area. Just get the password from the front desk and youâ€™re on-line in no time. As traveling adults we found the lack of kids at the hotel wonderful! The pool is open 24 hours and has some great water toys for guest use. They phoned us a few days in advance to see when we wanted the air turned on in our room -- very thoughtful. THE NEUTAL: There is no off-street parking although parking can be found on side streets near the hotel. Noise from the bar was not an issue for us although light sleepers may have a problem with it. If an iron and ironing board is required, call housekeeping. They will bring one. There are 3 levels of rooms; standard, deluxe and luxury. The luxury room is huge with 2 beds, balcony and Jacuzzi tub. The deluxe room has shower only and a balcony with pool view. For some unknown reason, a friend who booked at the same time we did (we were traveling together) ended up with a luxury room for the price of a standard. I was a tad annoyed to find we were paying more a night for a deluxe room than he was for his luxury room. When I inquired with the front desk I was politely told I was mis-informed. Alas, we saw his room and his bill â€“ when booking here, get specific with what you want and how much it is. I must add that our friend was very happy with his luck. THE NOT-SO-BAD: Like the other buildings on and around Duval Street, the La-te-da is an older building. With age come issues. I understand Key West has some frustrating water problems and Iâ€™m far more lenient with that sort of thing here than I am elsewhere. For example, our front porch had a bit of a sewer smell and the toilet sometimes needed an extra flushing. Ah well, we werenâ€™t there to sit on the porch to look at the pool, and pushing a handle down twice was no skin off our teeth. KEY WEST TIPS: If a full breakfast is more to the taste, a short distance up Duval Street is Duval Square. Right in there on the left is a great place for breakfast. I had the omelet of the day, which was made with shrimp, mushrooms, leeks and provolone. It was terrific. Aliceâ€™s restaurant is right across the street from the hotel for a great dinner. The filet is fab. For perfect dinner atmosphere and great food is Louieâ€™s Backyard. The service is good and the wine list is better than average but not astounding. For the budget conscious, there is a Dennyâ€™s right on Duval. For a truly memorable sunset, take a sunset sail on the Liberty Schooner. Beer, wine, champagne and appetizers are included with the fare. They also have a cash bar. Reservations are recommended. CONCLUSION: The La-te-da is Key West â€“ laid back, friendly and loaded with oodles of charm. Next time we need a Key West break from the world, we will definitely stay at the La-te-da.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here”
Reviews.Author: suntan2007
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a fantastic stay at the La Te Da Hotel. I booked last minute and since the occupany rate on racing boat weekend was high I was told I could stay my entire trip if I was willing to switch rooms twice. Having read previous reviews of how nice a place it was I thought what the heck and booked the room. WOW, did the hotel go out of their way to make me feel welcome and cared for during my stay. They even managed to switch things around so I only moved once midweek. Both rooms I had were great - lovely furnishings, right near the immaculate pool. One of the rooms had a two person jaccuzi- bliss! Breakfast was included in the room rate and was first class! Be sure and see the cabaret shows while you stay- I saw the "Broadway 3 Ways" show on Fri and Randy Roberts on Sat. Both were hysterically funny and amazing female impersonator shows. As a single female I felt extremely safe in the area where La Te Da was located, actually the whole Key West felt ok. You have the bar, restaurant and cabaret right there at your doorstep, which makes it convenient. It's located far enough down Duval St. to keep it quiet from the street bar noise but not so far away that walking is a problem to see the sights. Tips for vegetarians- walk to the "Cafe" restaurant on Southard St. for great and reasonable food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a relaxed traveler!”
Reviews.Author: stelienka
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the La Te Da for four nights for our honeymoon in early October. I must have looked at every single hotel in Key West online before I found this one. We came during the 'quiet' season and upon check-in, we were immediately upgraded to a deluxe room on the second floor that was very quiet, had a view of the pool and its own jacuzzi! The staff was extremely helpful, always smiling, the bartender made some VERY stiff drinks for us and the atmosphere was very relaxed. The complimentary breakfast works like a charm - you get a voucher at the reception desk which you present to the server at the restaurant with your choice of a dish. I strongly recommend the french toast, it was divine. The fruit cup was also always fresh and delicious. We never had dinner there but the menu looked very good. The hotel was very quiet and the bed extremely comfortable. The concierge was always ready to help us with directions, tips for things to see and do and reservations - he also showed us the best spot to park the car - there was street parking around the corner which was free and we left the car there for most of the stay! Now the truth about some of the other reviews: Florida is known for different standards of accomodations that the rest of the country. Key West IS in Florida. The pool, even though cleaned every day, could have used a paint job, as could some of the stairways and railings. Keep in mind though, it's very humid down there so paint jobs don't last forever. Could you see some signs of wear and tear in the bathroom? Yes, but it was a beautifully appointed room with very comfortable furnishings. The sink with the vanity mirror was one of the prettiest I've seen in a number of hotels and beats any Hyatt if you ask me. If you need a comparison with a chain, it's like a nicer Marriott or a Rennaissance but with oodles more charm. If you want a cookie-cutter room, stay at one of the resorts. If you want class and style and great service and you will not inspect everything with a magnifying glass, La Te Da is a place for you (I must say the housekeeping was immaculate - the room was always made up when we came back in the afternoon and we were given very nice pool/beach towels that we took out during the day and brought back at night). Bottom line - I highly recommend the place. It captures the flavor of Kew West in a classy and elegant way yet is inobtrusive and very relaxing. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Anniversary Ever”
Reviews.Author: msusoy
Reviews.Content: We checked the reviews before going there the first time. Highly exceeded our expectations. It was great, with a wonderful room, friendly staff, lovely pool... and of course the famous show was spectacular... Thanks LaTeDa. It was unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Love the La Te Da”
Reviews.Author: MicheinMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the La Te Da 7/21-7/24-excellent stay. Spacious room w/kign sized bed. Shower a little small okay. Very clean all around. Rose at the front desk was very helpful and nice. Great breakfast included w/price of room. Nice pool and bar area. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but HOT”
Reviews.Author: atpanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Te Da back in April for 4 days. We, as a straight couple, were treated very well by the staff. The front desk staff was especially helpful with suggestions for activities and restaurants. One surprise was that we were upgraded on check-in to the gorgeous room above the outside bar. Although I had originally requested a room away from the bar (as I had read on this site I should do) we took advantage of the opportunity. Big mistake. The cons: we were kept awake all night by the heat which was unbearable in a room w/out functioning air conditioning. Also, the inside bar was loud until all hours of the morning. Its hard to enjoy a vacation when you've had no sleep for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary on Duval Street!”
Reviews.Author: Drewyd
Reviews.Content: I went there with my partner for my birthday and had a fantastic time! Our plane was a bit late getting in and the front desk (which normally closes before we arrived) called our mobile phone to make sure we were still coming and the manager waited to greet us and take our bags when we arrived at the hotel. Our room was large, with a great balcony/porch overlooking the restaurant/bar and the pool area. The music could be heard in our room earlier in the evenings (before 10/10:30) but we loved it. It added to the festive atmosphere as we were getting ready to go out for drinks. The other guests in the hotel were nice as well, and we had a great time chatting with the bartenders about life on the island, where to go, etc. I didn't love the food in the restaurant, but the bar was great and its right across the street from Alice's, one of the best restaurants on the island. It's also just a short 5-10 minute walk to the galleries, bars (both gay and straight) and tons of restaurants. If you like the beach, La Te Da is closer to the beach than most other guesthouses on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: spacenews2
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with a great bar and restaurant. We met several of the other guests and most of the staff. Everyone was so nice - felt like a little family. The owner introduced himself to us at the piano bar and bought us a round! Speaking of the bar, it is wonderful. Great bartenders - Mindy and Kevin were so nice. The musicians were wonderful. The hotel is on the far end of Duval St - we walked a lot! This was not a problem for us and we enjoyed it, but I would caution you if walking is a problem. After we would hop down Duval every night we would come back to our hotel bar and spend the rest of our evening there. The pool is small, but a good size considering there are very few rooms. Our room was nice and had a private balcony over the pool area. I do not think they allow kids and that is just fine. This is a place for adults to sit and talk, drink and relax in the outdoor restaurant. You could sit there for hours - the staff is always attentive even if you are just eating the free breakfast. The free breakfast is very limited, but does the trick. I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For years, we have always begun our vacation with a martini at LaTeDa and were curious about staying there as it "appeared" quite nice. Upon checkin, we found our room to be large, as we requested a room with two queen bed and had a large bathroom (in need of much attention). Our air-conditioner was very loud and we called the front desk staff to advise. We were told that there was nothing that they could do, and were not offered to change rooms. We found that the noise of the air conditioner was a welcome in relation to the noise from the bar and restuarant. We stayed in this room for 5 days, throughout our stay, we experienced 2 seperate occasions when our toilet did not work and three days of waking with termites throughout the room. We advised the staff of all these problems, the toilet was repaired, however, when we told them of the termite problem, the front desk manager handed me a can of repellent and told me to kill them ourselves and the maid would clean them up later. The pool, once beautiful, has seen better days. The bottom is chipped throughout and the water is cloudy. The saving grace was the wonderful musicians that LaTeDa has in the evenings. I would recommend having a drink at the bar (wonderful bartenders) and listening to the music. However, for clean accomodations, I will look to the Southernmost House, which has beautiful rooms, pool and views of the Atlantic.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip down the coast of Florida. Stayed a couple nights in several areas. All of our hotels were in the 100-150 price range, with the LaTeDa coming in at 134 a night. This was BY FAR the nicest place we stayed. Simple elegance, nothing over the top, just extremely beautiful. What was even beter, it was the only hotel that included breakfast, and not just continental, a real breakfast, something you might pay about $10-$15 for. The terace was so beautiful and this was a big money saver for us. Also the parking was free, the only place we stayed that had free parking. The hotel staff was amazing. Expecially Shawn. He was there when we checked in, carried my bag (something no other hotel offered), highlighted all the best activities, recomended resturants, and was very friendly, telling us about the history of the place. This was probablly the best service I've ever recieved (maybe the four seasons. . .?). I've certainly never recieved this kind of attention at a hotel in this price range. It was located on the quite end of duval. An easy 5 min walk to the action, but very quite. I was super impressed!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here at the end of March and enjoyed the experience. The room was tastefully appointed with sitting area and the shower had plenty of hot water (always a must). I'm a light sleeper so quiet was important to me late at night and thats the way it was. A good nights sleep. Breakfast was included in the price. Eggs made to order one day and fruit plate the next were both excellent. I also ate dinner there both nights and was very impressed with the menu and quality of food. A bit pricey but worth it. Service was casual but professional. With a cabaret lounge and piano bar there is always something going on at night. A lively somewhat older crowd which was a nice change from the booze swilling spring breakers further down the street. My only complaint stems from the pool area. Its small, and the kitchen staff has to pass right behind sunbathers to get food and take out the garbage. This occured several times. Nevertheless, I will return to this fine hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: La Te Da Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1125 Duval St, Key West, FL 33040
